trans-unit.source: I received the error "Installation errors may occur because the security certificate updates that are required to install some Visual Studio components cannot be applied to this computer."
trans-unit.target: I received the error "Installation errors may occur because the security certificate updates that are required to install some Visual Studio components cannot be applied to this computer."

trans-unit.source: When attempting to install Visual Studio you receive the error "Installation errors may occur because the security certificate updates that are required to install some Visual Studio components cannot be applied to this computer.
trans-unit.target: When attempting to install Visual Studio you receive the error "Installation errors may occur because the security certificate updates that are required to install some Visual Studio components cannot be applied to this computer.

trans-unit.source: This can occur when you are not connected to the Internet or when a group policy setting on your computer prevents Visual Studio from automatically applying the security certificate updates.
trans-unit.target: This can occur when you are not connected to the Internet or when a group policy setting on your computer prevents Visual Studio from automatically applying the security certificate updates.

trans-unit.source:
If you choose to continue, some Visual Studio features may not work as expected."

Resolution
trans-unit.target:
If you choose to continue, some Visual Studio features may not work as expected."

Resolution

trans-unit.source: <ol> <li>Ensure that you are on a computer that is connected to the internet.
trans-unit.target: <ol> <li>Ensure that you are on a computer that is connected to the internet.

trans-unit.source: In some cases, Visual Studio is able to programmatically retrieve and then apply the required certificate updates so that the affected features can be successfully installed.
trans-unit.target: In some cases, Visual Studio is able to programmatically retrieve and then apply the required certificate updates so that the affected features can be successfully installed.

trans-unit.source: <li>Check the group policy setting on your computer that controls automatic certificate updates.
trans-unit.target: <li>Check the group policy setting on your computer that controls automatic certificate updates.

trans-unit.source: To check the setting, open the Group Policy Editor (gpedit.msc).
trans-unit.target: To check the setting, open the Group Policy Editor (gpedit.msc).

trans-unit.source: From the Local Group Policy Editor, under Computer Configuration, expand Administrative Templates, expand Internet Communication Management, and then click Internet Communication settings.
trans-unit.target: From the Local Group Policy Editor, under Computer Configuration, expand Administrative Templates, expand Internet Communication Management, and then click Internet Communication settings.

trans-unit.source: The setting that controls automatic certificate updates is Turn off Automatic Root Certificates Update.
trans-unit.target: The setting that controls automatic certificate updates is Turn off Automatic Root Certificates Update.

trans-unit.source: For Visual Studio to automatically retrieve and apply the required certificates, this setting should be Disabled.
trans-unit.target: For Visual Studio to automatically retrieve and apply the required certificates, this setting should be Disabled.

trans-unit.source: If the above steps do not resolve the issue, you can also try to manually install the required certificate updates.
trans-unit.target: If the above steps do not resolve the issue, you can also try to manually install the required certificate updates.

trans-unit.source: For information on how to obtain Windows update root certificates, see How to get a Root Certificate update for Windows.
trans-unit.target: For information on how to obtain Windows update root certificates, see How to get a Root Certificate update for Windows.

trans-unit.source: You can also try Repairing Visual Studio from the Control Panel.
trans-unit.target: You can also try Repairing Visual Studio from the Control Panel.
